Line 60: Line 60:
BartPE is similar to [[Windows Preinstallation Environment]] (WinPE) but they differ in several aspects:
BartPE is similar to [[Windows Preinstallation Environment]] (WinPE) but they differ in several aspects:
* [[WinPE]] is an official Microsoft product. BartPE is not endorsed or supported by [[Microsoft]]
* [[WinPE]] is an official Microsoft product. BartPE is not endorsed or supported by [[Microsoft]]
â
* The tools needed to make a BartPE installation (PE Builder) are [[freeware]]. WinPE 1.x was initially available only to Microsoft [[Original equipment manufacturer|OEM]] partners and Microsoft Software Assurance customers. However, with the release of the [[Windows Automated Installation Kit|Windows Automated Installation Kit (AIK)]], WinPE 2.0 is now available as an included component at no charge.
+
* The tools needed to make a BartPE installation (PE Builder) are [[freeware|free]]. WinPE 1.x was initially available only to Microsoft [[Original equipment manufacturer|OEM]] partners and Microsoft Software Assurance customers. However, with the release of the [[Windows Automated Installation Kit|Windows Automated Installation Kit (AIK)]], WinPE 2.0 is now available as an included component at no charge.
* BartPE offers a wealth of user-provided custom [[plugin]]s. Since WinPE 1.x was initially difficult to obtain due the strict licensing options, it does not have the same wide availability of plugins.
* BartPE offers a wealth of user-provided custom [[plugin]]s. Since WinPE 1.x was initially difficult to obtain due the strict licensing options, it does not have the same wide availability of plugins.
* BartPE uses an XML based 'Start Menu' called nu2menu which calls up basic functions. Windows PE relies on console commands within a GUI-less, command-line environment (although the latter is also able to run GUI-based applications).
* BartPE uses an XML based 'Start Menu' called nu2menu which calls up basic functions. Windows PE relies on console commands within a GUI-less, command-line environment (although the latter is also able to run GUI-based applications).
